intro: Thesium dollineri subsp. simplex, commonly known as the simple thesium, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in open habitats such as woodlands and grasslands. It is a perennial herb that produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and threatened species.
